newsitem.title: USA: Rom sees break-even results, small profits. [CORRECTED 14:50 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Rom sees break-even results, small profits. [CORRECTED 14:50 GMT]

text.p: RomTech Inc said Thursday it expects to break even or make a small profit in the fourth quarter.
The company also said its recently announced distribution relationships with GT Interactive Corp, ExperVision and ImageWare, will contribute to revenue and earnings growth during fiscal 1998.

The company said it expects recently introduced new products like PowerHunter, the new Galaxy of Games titles and the new Galaxy of Home Office Help series to enhance its growth in the office and consumer products groups.
The company reported a loss per share for the third quarter of $0.14 compared to a loss of $0.12 for the same period a year ago (corrects to make clear the company made a loss).
